arma

Class RunningStat

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.RunningStat

  • public class RunningStat
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides statistical measures that are updated iterative per sample.

    Useful if the storage of individual samples is not possible or not required.

    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann

    • Field Summary

      The amount of samples

      The variance of all samples

      Returns the amount of samples.

      Resets all statistical values.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(double sample)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Recalculates the statistical values with inclusion of the sample.
        Parameters:
        sample - The sample
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - NaN is not valid sample.

      • count

        public double count()
        Returns the amount of samples.

        Note: Returns a double. Therefore, no more than 2^53 (approx. 9 * 10^15) samples can be processed before the stored amount of samples suffers a loss of precision due to gaps between representable integers as double.

        Returns:
        The amount

      • min

        public double min()
        Returns the smallest sample.
        Returns:
        The minimum

      • max

        public double max()
        Returns the largest sample.
        Returns:
        The maximum

      • mean

        public double mean()
        Returns the mean of all samples.
        Returns:
        The mean

      • var

        public double var()
        Returns the variance of all samples with normalisation by count() - 1.
        Returns:
        The variance

      • var

        public double var(int normType)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the variance of all samples.

        Performs either normalisation by count() - 1 (normType = 0) or #count() (normType = 1).

        Parameters:
        normType - The normalisation
        Returns:
        The variance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The normalisation type must be one of 0 or 1, but was: normType.

      • stddev

        public double stddev()
        Returns the standard deviation of all samples with normalisation by count() - 1.
        Returns:
        The standard deviation.

      • stddev

        public double stddev(int normType)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the standard deviation of all samples.

        Performs either normalisation by count() - 1 (normType = 0) or #count() (normType = 1).

        Parameters:
        normType - The normalisation
        Returns:
        The standard deviation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The normalisation type must be one of 0 or 1, but was: normType.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets all statistical values.
